definitions.text: take to be the case or to be true; accept without verification or proof
examples: I assume his train was late

definitions.text: take on titles, offices, duties, responsibilities
examples: When will the new President assume office?

definitions.text: take on a certain form, attribute, or aspect
examples: His voice took on a sad tone
The story took a new turn
he adopted an air of superiority
She assumed strange manners
The gods assume human or animal form in these fables

definitions.text: take on as one's own the expenses or debts of another person
examples: I'll accept the charges
She agreed to bear the responsibility
He assumes the lotus position
She took her seat on the stage
We took our seats in the orchestra
She took up her position behind the tree
strike a pose

definitions.text: seize and take control without authority and possibly with force; take as one's right or possession
examples: He assumed to himself the right to fill all positions in the town
he usurped my rights
She seized control of the throne after her husband died
She assumed indifference, even though she was seething with anger
he feigned sleep

definitions.text: take up someone's soul into heaven
examples: This is the day when May was assumed into heaven
What should I wear today?
He put on his best suit for the wedding
The princess donned a long blue dress
The queen assumed the stately robes
He got into his jeans
